perturbation.original_text: 3.1.3 Aucta shall provide to ETON all regulatory and compliance-related documents and correspondence with the FDA within five (5) Business Days after submission or receipt of such documents or correspondence with the FDA relating to the Products or Dossiers for the Products, including without limitation any oral (notes thereof) and written correspondence with FDA relating to the Products or Dossiers and any compliance-related oral (notes thereof) or written correspondence with FDA relating to the Product(s)' manufacturing facility(ies)' status or deficiencies.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.1.3 Aucta shall provide to ETON all regulatory and compliance-related documents and correspondence with the FDA within one (1) Business Days after submission or receipt of such documents or correspondence with the FDA relating to the Products or Dossiers for the Products, including without limitation any oral (notes thereof) and written correspondence with FDA relating to the Products or Dossiers and any compliance-related oral (notes thereof) or written correspondence with FDA relating to the Product(s)' manufacturing facility(ies)' status or deficiencies.
perturbation.explanation: The change from five (5) business days to one (1) business day to provide regulatory and compliance-related documents and correspondence with the FDA could be considered an unreasonably short time frame, potentially violating regulations or guidelines that implicitly require a 'reasonable time' for such actions. While no specific law mandates the exact timeframe, such a short period may make it difficult for Aucta to comply, potentially leading to breaches and disputes.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied violation of regulations requiring 'reasonable time' for compliance-related actions

perturbation.original_text: 7.4 Notice of Infringement. If either Party shall learn of (a) any claim or assertion that the manufacture, use or marketing of the Product under this Agreement, or any other action taken by either party in performance of its obligations hereunder infringes, misappropriates or otherwise violates the intellectual property rights of any Third Party, or (b) the actual or threatened infringement, misappropriation or other violation by any Third Party of the intellectual property rights of any party that are the subject of this Agreement ("Intellectual Rights Suits"), then the Party becoming so informed shall as soon as reasonably practicable, but in all events within three (3) Business Days thereafter (the "Infringement Notification Date"), notify the other Party of such claim or assertion, or actual or threatened infringement, misappropriation or other violation.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.4 Notice of Infringement. If either Party shall learn of (a) any claim or assertion that the manufacture, use or marketing of the Product under this Agreement, or any other action taken by either party in performance of its obligations hereunder infringes, misappropriates or otherwise violates the intellectual property rights of any Third Party, or (b) the actual or threatened infringement, misappropriation or other violation by any Third Party of the intellectual property rights of any party that are the subject of this Agreement ("Intellectual Rights Suits"), then the Party becoming so informed shall notify the other Party of such claim or assertion, or actual or threatened infringement, misappropriation or other violation when such notification is deemed appropriate.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of the 'three (3) Business Days' deadline to notify the other party of any infringement creates uncertainty and contradicts standard practices for intellectual property protection. The addition of 'when such notification is deemed appropriate' introduces subjectivity, potentially violating legal requirements or best practices that necessitate prompt action to preserve IP rights.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied violation of requirements for prompt action and notification in intellectual property law.

perturbation.original_text: 11.2 Termination for Breach. The Agreement may be terminated by either Party by written notice to the other at any time if the other Party (the "Breaching Party") is in material breach or default of any of its obligations hereunder or any of its representations or warranties as follows: (i) the terminating Party shall send a written notice of the material breach or material default to the Breaching Party and (ii) the termination shall become effective a) thirty (30) days after sending notice of the breach if the breach is non-payment of amounts due hereunder, such as milestone, minimum royalty or royalties amounts and b) sixty (60) days after sending notice of the breach for all other breaches unless the Breaching Party has cured any such material breach or material default prior to the expiration of the thirty (30) or sixty (60) day period as the case may be; or if for non- payment breaches such material default or material breach is not capable of being cured within such sixty (60) day period and the Breaching Party has commenced activities reasonably expected to cure such material breach or material default within such sixty (60) day period and thereafter uses diligent efforts to complete the cure as soon as practicable, but in no event shall such period exceed ninety (90) days.
perturbation.changed_text: 11.2 Termination for Breach. The Agreement may be terminated by either Party by written notice to the other at any time if the other Party (the "Breaching Party") is in material breach or default of any of its obligations hereunder or any of its representations or warranties as follows: (i) the terminating Party shall send a written notice of the material breach or material default to the Breaching Party and (ii) the termination shall become effective immediately after sending notice of the breach. There is no cure period.
perturbation.explanation: Eliminating the cure period violates the principles of contract law, which generally allow a reasonable time for a breaching party to remedy the breach. By making the termination effective immediately, the change introduces a potential violation of good faith and fair dealing, especially if the breach is minor or easily curable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of contract law principles requiring a reasonable cure period for material breaches.
